newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU STRESSES THREAT OF DISEASE FROM THE EAST.
newsitem.headline: EU STRESSES THREAT OF DISEASE FROM THE EAST.

text.p: East European countries will have the added responsibility of protecting the EU's farming industry from disease if they join the Union, European Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler said on Tuesday.

Fischler told a meeting with applicant states "that associated countries will be protecting our frontier which will increase threefold and that they will carry important responsibilities," a European Commission official said.
The Commission said in a statement that Fischler had told the applicant countries they must adopt EU veterinary and phytosanitary policies into their national law.

He added that the so-called PECOS countries should use the financial assistance available under the EU's PHARE programme to adapt their inspection and control arrangements to meet the new requirements.
"Obviously some countries are more advanced than others but all expressed a full commitment to meeting the EU's requirements," the statement said.

In a background document released last week on the importance of veterinary and plant health controls in PECOS countries the Commission blamed outbreaks of foot and mouth on animals imported from Eastern Europe. -- Brussels Newsroom 32
